dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COYOTE lopes through shimmering heat waves. The sky abo is a cloudless blue.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My Father used to say that the only way Evil came into your life was if you invited it. I'm not sure about that, at least not anymore. What I cLQ know is this: we are born alone, and we die alone, and what happens in between is all that matters. The choices we make, the people whose paths we cross -- these are the things that determine our fate. The coyote ducks through a hole in a chain-link fence, we through the rusted ruins of a --

dialogues.speaker: DERELICT AMUSEMENT PARK
dialogues.text: Broken-down rides, weed-clogged machinery, sideshow trail bleached bone-white.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Most stories start with a beginning. His began with an ending. I never knew where he really came from. I guess it's not important anymore. All I know is that he'd been running his entire life. Running for so long that he no longer knew whether he was running away from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coyote reaches a steep ridge, looks out over a patchy Southwestern town.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- or towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks, noise, metal and grime. JOHN BLAZE (30s, ruggedly handsome) is running late. He sprints across the workshop floor, shedding his welder's kit as he heads for the time CLUNK! He punches out -- but LITTLE MIKE (50s, trailer tr fast) has caught him in the act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where do you chink you're going, Blaze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you are! Blaze jumps on his bike - a muscular, battered BSA.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get back to work or your ass is fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaa n? You say that every time. Blaze kicks-starts the bike. It ROARS thunderously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the noise) Well I mean it this time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gunning the throttle) See you tomorrow, Little Mike! The bike HOWLS, hauls up on its back wheel. Screams out t shop leaving Little Mike holding his ears. The other work WHOOP and HOLLER, especially when Blaze snags a pair of B CUTTERS from a passing tool rack on the fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze skids out of the yard, matching speed with a pickup which is just passing by. COOP is driving. JED and MURPHY are LAUGHING in back. Clearly, they're friends with Blaze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skin of your teeth, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping his watch) Yeah, we're on a tight schedule!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you waiting for? Blaze burns away, leaving the pickup for dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FREIGHT TRAIN thunders across the landscape. To the Eas Blaze and the pickup are coming on an intercept course. Blaze reaches the train first, climbs the gravel incline the tracks. Matches its speed, pulls up alongside a bolte container car. He reaches back, pulls the cutters from hi saddles bags -- -- and skillfully chops the lock with one hand. The heavy iron door slides open, pulled back by it's own inertia. Blaze throws the cutters inside, peels away -- -- and comes back with a vengeance, throttled to the max. jams the front brake on at the last possible moment -- The bike cartwheels. Tail over head. Pulls a complete thr sixty up into the car --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: -- and lands perfectly, screeching to a halt. Blaze WHOOP his exhilaration. And if you don't believe this, watch extreme motocross as we CUT TO:

dialogues.text: being wrenched aside, revealing Coop's pickup holding ste alongside the train. Jed and Murphy ride the cargo bed li surfers. Blaze starts tossing boxes out of the car and into the tr Jed and Murphy stack `em and rack `em. We get glimpses of the loot: CD Players, VCRs, personal packages, luggage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Mickey was right on the money!

dialogues.text: Car twenty-two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you gentlemen, that's it for today! Jed bangs on the cab roof. Coop waves. Jed and Murphy salute. The pickup peels away. Blaze retrieves his bike. Stands it back up, kicks it alive, guns the throttle and -- cold jumps straight out of the car. Seconds later he's powering away, ripping up a storm, chasing the pickup tow the horizon. Far, far behind, the police are still coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK AND RITA SIMPSON (50s) are eating Chinese food with their daughter, ROXANNE (20s) and Blaze. Roxanne is beautiful, easygoing. She's also seven months pregnant. The Simpsons are simple, working-class folk. Judging by t strained atmosphere, it's evident that they don't care to much for Blaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon, would you pass me the vegetables. Chuck obliges, takes a drink of his beer, nods to Blaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how're things going at the shop, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scarfing down his food) Good, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Yeah? Cause Mike says you've been slacking off, horsing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed, protective)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Rox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze sets his fork down, wipes his mouth with his napkin Conjures up his best earnest look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is, Mr. Simpson, I've been thinking about clearing out of there. Maybe opening up a shop of my own -- Roxanne raises an eyebrow at this. News to her.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: See, I've been saving up. You know, for the baby and all. And I-- DOORBELL. Roxanne rises to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted, looking to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, so anyway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze looks over. Two Sheriff's Deputies, LUCAS COLE and RICK GEORGE, are standing in the doorway. Roxanne looks pissed -- like this isn't the first time this has happene Blaze stands, approaches. Clearly, he knows them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocky, wary) Lucas. Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny. We'd like you to come down the station. Their demeanor is hard. Won't take "no" for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I finish eating? Nope. Blaze squirms, feels Roxanne's eyes on him. He turn to her, tries to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, hon. It's just routine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is by now. Just let me know if you're staying overnight. She goes back to her dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze enters. The apartment is dark- TV flickers. Roxanne is sleeping on the couch. On the coffee table: Chinese leftovers, fortune cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. She's sound asleep. He crouches, touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Roxanne barely stirs, deeply groggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. Everything's okay. Jed and Murph just got a little boisterous at The Prairie Dog last night. Cops wanted to read us the riot act, that's all -- She yawns, curls up, starts to drift away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried about you. And I don't like your friends. But Blaze won't let her go back to sleep. He jostles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I want to show you something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 CONTINUED: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you do. But I'm half-asleep and you're an ass-hole. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Rox. This is important. He drags her up off the couch. Makes her stand up. She MOANS, scowls, but he gets her on her feet. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I have to go to work tomorrow BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offers her coat) Put your coat on. You'll be glad you did. Promise. It'll be an adventure. A mystery tour. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be good. She stomps to the bathroom. Blaze chuckles inwardly. Stea a fortune cookie from the left-overs, snaps it open -- The fortune is blank. Both sides. He tosses it away. CUT TO: COYOTE EYES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: glittering black, watching.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm here. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze and Roxanne creep through a hole in the outer fence making their way to -- BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going. It's just up there.

dialogues.speaker: A BROKEN-DOWN CAROUSEL
dialogues.text: Must have been magnificent in its day. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not riding one of those stupid horses. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to ride, just climb up. She steps up onto the wooden platform, smiles back at him ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to grow up one day, Johnny Blaze. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I can help it. He follows her up onto the ride. She weaves through the wooden animals. Starting to enjoy this secret adventure. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going, keep going -- She comes around the other side, catches her breath. The whole valley is spread out before her -- a glorious scatt of diamonds on velvet. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. ROXANNE (TURNING BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever hear of a carnival wedding? Roxanne shakes her head. Blaze is fiddling with a crisp, dollar bill, folding it, making something.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: If a man and a woman walk around a carousel going backwards, they're considered hitched. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made that up. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear to God. He finishes folding the bill. The "one" is now neatly set top of an ORIGAMI WEDDING BAND like a paper jewel.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: You want this? (CONTINUED)     9 CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, offering her hand. He slips the ring onto her finger and she examines it, lit up inside. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. He smiles at her joy, wrestles with what he's about to sa BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd I ever find you? ROXANNE (SHRUGGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fate? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in fate. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it believes in you. They hug each other fiercely. A long, soulful embrace. Blaze looks to the city lights beneath them once more.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE, (CONT ' D)
dialogues.text: Here's the thing, John. We're having a baby. You can't keep acting like everything's a game. I need you with me. I need to know I'll be able to wake up in the morning and see your face next to mine. Not have to worry that you spent the night in jail. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a life. At least not one I'm interested in living. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm gonna get my shit together. For Leal, this time, (EARNEST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you, Rox. I'll always be there for you. She takes his hand and places it on her belly. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't promise me, promise her. THE COYOTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: blinks. THUNDER from the next scene prelaps as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Blaze enters, drenched from head to toe, frantic. Roxanne's arms are filled with laundry. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go. Get your stuff together. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? What's wrong? Roxanne follows Blaze into the bedroom. ROXANNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up. The police are coming. Grab your things. We have to go. She sags, clearly been through this before. He tosses a suitcase onto the bed, looks back at her. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it, Rox! FOLLOWING BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he storms into the bathroom. Reaches behind the high cistern, retrieves a hidden HANDGUN. He jumps down. Tears the side panel off the old bath tub. There's a stack of F BLACK BOXES hidden within. Blaze drags them out, drops on It pops open, spilling UNCUT DIAMONDS all over the floor. Blaze CURSES, struggles to gather up the loot.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Johnny -- ON ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing in the doorway. She sawit all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain hammers down. SIRENS whine. Blaze shoves Roxanne and the suitcase into a beat-up El Camino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze climbs behind the wheel, guns the engine even befor Roxanne has buckled in. He gnashes into reverse, grinds t car into a backwards spin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- nearly clipping another car pulling in. He jumps the c and races off into the rain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- passing a POLICE CAR coming the other way. Roxanne glances at Blaze, angry and disappointed. Blaze struggles. The rain. The wipers. The fogging windshield. It's a bad time to be Johnny Blaze. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop car is turning, heading back in their direction. ROXANNE JOHN --

dialogues.text: Blaze floors the gas. The speedometer leaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Blaze fights to keep it together. The road ahead is dangerously winding. Tires SQUEAL as he hauls a sketchy t Roxanne gasps, fearful, bracing herself. The police are gaining. FLASHING LIGHTS flood the interior. ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, John -- Another sketchy turn. Blaze spins the wheel, brakes, hard Too hard. The car hydroplanes, finds purchase --

dialogues.text: Blaze stirs, blood streaming down his face. The windshiel is blown open. Rain pours in. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne --? He struggles to free himself from his seat, SEES a torn s belt hanging beside him -- the passenger seat mr)ty. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Mr. Blaze --? Blaze turns, SEES a nervous DOCTOR standing behind him. BLAZE

dialogues.text: Is she going to make it? DOCTOR

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Roxanne, on life support, hooked up to an array monitors. Sleeping Beauty, still as death. Blaze sits beside her bed. Handcuffed. Numb. Rain streams against a nearby window. Tree limbs tap against the glass, like gho scratching to get in. TWO STATE TROOPERS stand guard at a respectable distance, MURMURING to each other. Elsewhere -- BOOTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walk purposefully on linoleum. Passing bay after bay. Beyond the Troopers, SOMEONE is approaching, half seen through layers of glass. Blaze HEARS the footsteps, lifts his weary head. The shad keeps coming, half-glimpsed between partitions as it draw

dialogues.text: She's dying. Starke nods, places a COIN in Blaze's palm. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of deal? STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives. You work for me. Something about Starke's eyes. Commanding and haunting at the same time. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of work? Starke just keeps smiling. Lays a comforting hand on Blaz shoulder as we drift towards Roxanne's beeping EEG.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When I was young, I was told that our souls wander while we sleep. Sometimes they get lost. Sometimes they never make it back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN on John Blaze as he switches on the light, looks the mirror. Those five years of work have taken their tol A haggard reflection gazes back at him, He stares. And stares. Right into his pain.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- but if they dQ return, they bring messages. And I guess thhat's how the dead speak to us -- in memories that may be dreams, and dreams that feel like memories. Blaze turns off the light. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: -- hunger. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking for Starke. I'm looking for my kid. We find one, we'll find the other. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then --?
CONTINUED: NOMI (POINTEDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I don't care about the rest. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A POWERFUL DUST STORM
dialogues.text: Raging full force. Blinding dust and debris batter closin store fronts. Roof sheeting tears away, street lamps ratt hapless LOCALS struggle to get indoors. A lone coyote lopes through the havoc, trotting purposefu against the wind, dodging cars, ducking flying boards and planks. The animal passes under a sign: "HOWARDSVILLE CAR RENTS".

dialogues.speaker: A MAN'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: Lupine. Carnivorous. Speaking into a payphone handset. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she comfortable? Are you feeding her properly? VOICE (FILTERED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's alright, I guess. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE COYOTE
dialogues.text: running between rows of rental cars. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know where you're taking her? VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's figured it out. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how does she feel about that? VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrigan paces the edge of a billowing wheatfield, wired his cell phone. Dawn peeks over the horizon. In the distance, we SEE Landsdale and Odell waiting with Rain. (CC I::LACED )
CONTINUED: CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a psychologist. She's a fucking freak, alright? Always has been. Sooner I get her out of my sight, the better. THE COYOTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: approaches the phone booth situated beside the rental off Inside the booth, the man is half-seen. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the most important thing in your life, Carrigan. Make sure she arrives safely. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be careful. She'll kill if she gets the chance. The man hangs up, turns to look at the coyote staring up him. Once again, we meet -- AMBROSE STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same sky-blue eyes flecked with metal. Starke and Coyote stare at each other, indifferent to the storm raging arou them- He starts towards the rental office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windows RATTLE. The storm HOWLS. A portly rental agent, J PETROWSKY, is closing up shop. He gathers his papers, tur out the lights. A TV on the counter is on: WEATHERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- experiencing extraordinary conditions. Tornadoes blanketing much of East Texas, with reports of extensive damage and gusts of up to seventy miles per hour -- As Pecrowsky turns off the TV, we hear the door CHIME. Starke enters, bringing a strong gust of wind with him. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, guy, I'm just closing up. Starke looks to a clock on the wall -- it's 4:55. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the hours posted outside, you're still open.
CONTINUED: PETROWSKY (EXASPERATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mister, in case you hadn't noticed, there's a storm coming -- tornadoes, whatever. I'm trying to get out of here. Starke fixes Petrowsky with a stern gaze. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to rent a car -- (reading Petrowsky's name tag) -- "Jim" . Something in Starke's tone gives Petrowsky pause. He glan to the window and the growing storm beyond. We SEE the coyote out there, watching from across the way. PETROWSKY (RELENTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, alright, have a seat. Starke sits. Petrowsky moves behind his desk. PETROWSKY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. --? STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starke. First name, Ambrose. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (typing in the name) Starke, okay. What kind of car were you looking for? Starke picks up a laminated placard featuring various car STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Cadillac Deville? I noticed you had one in your lot outside. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, already spoken for. How `bout a full-size car? I can give you a Chevy Malibu, Ford Taurus -- Starke deliberates. Outside, the storm seems to grow stronger. Petrowsky shifts in his seat, trying to mask hi impatience. Were he observant enough, he might also notic that the wall clock has stopped. (C: VT=`7:,'-')
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: PETROWSKY, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: You want the Taurus? Give you a good deal, mid-size price. $37.99 a day, can't beat that. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had my heart set on the Cadillac, Jim. PETROWSKY (ANNOYED NOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caddy's taken. Now look, I'm trying to be accommodating here, but I really am in a hurry. So what's it going to be? Another beat as Starke stares Petrowsky down. Gradually, lights in the office begin to dim. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taurus, then. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Can I see a driver's license? Starke reaches into his jacket, handing over a license. Petrowsky types in the required information, trying to ig the vague feeling of uneasiness settling over him.

dialogues.speaker: PETROWSKY, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: How many days do you need it for? STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, three -- PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other drivers? STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll be paying by --? STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need a three hundred dollar deposit. Starke nods, removing a money clip from his jacket, deftl sliding out three crisp, brand-new hundred dollar bills. ( CO N TI N U E D /)
CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: PETROWSKY, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: What about refueling? (off Starke' s look) We've got three options. You can purchase a full tank in advance, you can fill it up yourself before you return it, or you can have us do it, but then we have to charge you four dollars a gallon. Most people go for the tank in advance. Less hassle. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it myself. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey-dokey. Petrowsky enters the final data, hits "PRINT". As the ren agreement begins feeding out, we hear a HORN FiONK. Starke turns. A mini-van has pulled up outside. A MOUSY WOMAN sits behind the wheel. A BOY sits in the back seat. The coyote is still there, but it pays no attention to th STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Petrowsky? PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Petrowsky slides the agreement to Starke, takes out a pen

dialogues.speaker: PETROWSKY, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: Here you go. Just your standard rental agreement. You get up to 150 miles a day for free, twenty cents a mile after that. If you want additional personal accident insurance it's five dollars a day, another nine-ninety-nine if you want the loss/damage waiver. Your basic rental rate, plus applicable state and local tax. You just need to initial here, here, and here -- (indicating various items) -- and give me your John Hancock on the line right here. Petrowsky offers Starke a pen. He doesn't take it. Instea he pulls out a pair of bifocals. With agonizing slowness, Starke begins to peruse the rental agreement.

dialogues.speaker: PETROWSKY, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: Is there a o oblem --?
CONTINUED : (4) STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The price you quoted was $37,99, the mid- size rate. But you've listed the daily rate here as $62.99. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did? Starke turns the agreement around for Petrowsky to see. PETROWSKY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, I'm sorry, you're absolutely right. That's the Caddy rate. Guess I entered it in by mistake -- Starke looks up at Petrowsky over the rim of his bifocals the timbre of his voice taking on a decidedly frigid turn STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you trying to cheat me, Jim? PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, not at all -- STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd like a new contract specifying the appropriate rate. Petrowsky squirms, uncomfortable. For in that pregnant moment, without either participant uttering at word, the entire nature of the transaction seems to have changed. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can't we just go with the contract we've got here? I'll make a note of it and knock a day's rental off the total when you return it. What do you say? STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say the Devil's in the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! Petrowsky flies through the plate glass window. He lands on the concrete, stunned, bleeding from multiple lacerations. He tries to sit up, but his right arm is broken, horribly mangled. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping, in shock) Jesus -- Jesus --
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There've been times in my life when the world seemed so hateful and vindictive that I just wanted to die -- Helen Petrowsky bolts from the mini-van. The boy watches his mother rushes to her husband's side. HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim?! Jim, what happened?! Petrowsky clutches at his wife's arm, trying to speak. A shard of glass has penetrated his larynx. PETROWSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- H-helen -- get -- a--away -- Petrowsky's eyes widen in horror. Helen follows his gaze

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Certain twists of that fate felt like nothing more than God's spite. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: strides towards them, his face a veil of unmerciful conte The dust storm has taken on Biblical proportions, whippin and roiling around him, becoming an extension of his fury He snatches Helen up by the throat, snapping her neck wit inhuman strength, flings her lifeless body to the ground then he brings his boot heel down on Petrowsky'shead. crushing it like an _aashell.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was obvious to me that I'd done something wrong. Broken some secret rule known only to Him. And as such, would be punished for my sins -- Starke turns now, regarding the mini-van. The boy is nowh in sight. He approaches, looks inside. The boy has fled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are low on the ground, tracking with the terrified Boy he squirms his way beneath the cars. He pauses, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking right, then left. No sign of Starke. The Boy shudders, truing to stifle his sniveling. Then -- (C^r-_NCE2)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But I had it all wrong. And I see that now, with such clarity I sometimes feel my heart will break -- THE COYOTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: appears, creeping along a parallel aisle. It pauses, lowering its snout, peering at the boy from afar. The Boy freezes. FOOTSTEPS approaching. He squirms around for a better view --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE Starke's boot heels a few dozen yards away, gradua closing in on the car beneath which the Boy hides. The Boy shuts his eyes. The FOOTSTEPS draw closer, then stop. The Boy opens his eyes. Starke's hoots are just an arm's length away.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There's a world out there that's neither right nor wrong. Neither kind nor cruel. Fair or unfair. It simply is.. Existing in all it's bliss and pain. A HAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slips under the body of the car.Butit's not a human hand. It's the hand of a beast -- blackandtwisted, taloned. Wit a sudden movement, the hand flipsthecar up, sending the enter vehicle spiraling into theair.The Boy lies there, exposed like a bug beneath an upturned rock. He looks up

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And what seems like cruel fate is really only Nature, red in tooth and claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a BRIEF FLASH of Starke. No longer a human silhouette, but a SNARLING, lupine beast. The Trickster. The Black Dog. Rushing towards us with open jaws as we -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUMMER races along a desolate stretch of highway, passi through an inhospitable landscape of buttes, mesas, and c     43-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrigan drives. Landsdale rides shotgun, dozing. Odell i in back with Rain, her hands tightly bound. She keeps to herself, clutching her skeleton doll, stares out at the passing landscape. Odell offers her a bag of chips. ODELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some food, kid? Rain doesn't respond. Odell rustles the bag. ODELL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Eat a chip or something. CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not gonna eat, Odell. Just shut up and get some sleep. ODELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep. Every time I close my eyes, I see the face of that thing, Lloyd BURNING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) -- Christ. CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put it out of your head. ODELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could put it out of my head, I wouldn't be awake now, would I? Landsdale stirs. Carrigan gestures at the barren landscap CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out there, what do you see? LANDSDALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick. CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Miles and miles of nothing. And there's a lot of weird shit running around in that nothing. How many people you know seen a UFO, huh? Ten? Twenty? Hell, it's on every goddamn paper at the supermarket. You believe that shit, the whole country's being overrun by those bug-eyed motherfuckers. (CAN":NC,'.-)
CONTINUED: LANDSDALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, eyes closed) Probe you in the ass, they get the chance. ODELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point, Mr. Serling? CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point is; everybody's seen somethina. Ghosts, aliens, Bigfoot, whatever -- ODELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't no freaking Bigfoot! You see what it did to Albright? Punched his head clean off! CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what that thing was. All I know is, Starke's paying us a butt- load of money to deliver the kid to him. We were told we'd see things and we were told to look the other way. You want to cut out? I'll pull over right here. LANDSDALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your shirt on, B. We didn't come this far just to limp home with nothing. Right, Odell? Odell settles back into his seat, uneasy. ODELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. But I'd still like to know what that thing was. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the Ghost Rider. Everybody looks at her. It's the first thing she's said. CARRIGAN (CHUCKLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Ghost Rider"? Get that off the back of an Oakridge Boys album or something? You think that shit scares me? RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should. He's going to kill you all. ODELL (FREAKING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? SiE? ! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CO.JT N =i)
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: ODELL, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about! Fucking Chatty Cathy sitting back here with me! Carrigan glances in the rear-view mirror, makes eye-conta with Rain, does his level-best not to be spooked. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred miles-per-hour plus. Whip around to SEE --

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE AND NOMI,
dialogues.text: riding their cycles. Up ahead is a postal truck. Blaze HONKS, waves to the DRIVER. He's got a postcard in his ha He hands it to the driver through the open door, then decreases his speed, falling back alongside Nomi. As they scream over a hill, we SEE the White Buffalo Indi Casino and Lodge in the distance. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this. I spent the last six years trying to forget this place. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any idea where Billy-Ray might be headed? NOMI NO -- BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we should start with where he's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chiming CACOPHONY. Acres of penny slots and video poker Roulette wheels CLATTERING. Blackjack tables spinning. Blaze and Nomi weave their way through the maze. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband used to work here? NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Ray dealt blackjack, poker. Worked the casino circuit. We met in Vegas. Things kind of went downhill after that.

dialogues.speaker: RODENBURG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Got a lot of nerve showing your face here again.
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. Chief of Security, VINCE RODENBURG (30s, full- himself), storms towards them, flanked by TWO SECURITY GO NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, Vince, this is the last place I want to be. But we need to find Billy- Ray. He took Rain. RODENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry' The Deal Man hasn't been back in weeks. (gesturing for them to leave) You have a nice day now. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you must've talked to him. Do you know where he's headed? Just tell me that. RODENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I? His babysitter? I don't know where he is, Nome, and if I did, I sure as hell wouldn't be telling you. (looking to the other guards) Show these two ass-holes to the door. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this is important. We're talking about a kidnapping. RODENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sizing Blaze up) We are? And who is ? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a friend. RODENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ri h t. Nomi tell you what a blue ribbon slut she was? Do anything to support that needle habit of hers. Truth, 'bout the only person that hasn't had her around here is me. Blaze steps forward now, angry, threatening. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. RO DENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you gonna get all Steven Segal on me, tough guy? Pull a fucking Glimmer Man?
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze moves, twists Rodenburg's arm like rope, wrenches h thumb backwards, SLAMS Rodenburg face-first into one of t Plexiglas booths where people dive for dollars. The goons pull their pieces. Blaze just ups the pain. RODENBURG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -w-w--wait!! ! (in agony, grimacing) --oh, fuck, just wait a second -- The goons hesitate. CUSTOMERS stare. Blaze seethes. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to understand something, Vince. I am, by nature, an inherently violent man and there's not much in the way of bad that I haven't already inflicted on this miserable world -- (applying even more pressure) So unless the idea of learning to drive a wheelchair with your mouth sounds appealing, I suggest you apologize to my friend and tell us WHERE THE FUCK BILLY-

dialogues.speaker: RAY IS HEADED
dialogues.text: RODENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I don't know -- Blaze gives Rodenburg's thumb a savage twist. RODENBURG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrrghh! H-he was -- ngh -- up at their old house, last night! BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And? RODENBURG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry -- I'm fucking sorry! Blaze releases him. As the goons close in, Blaze deftly relieving Goon #1 of his handgun and turns it back on him BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it. The goons relent. Blaze and Nomi exit, leaving Rodenburg slumped on the floor, cradling his mangled hand. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swath of cheap housing, part-finished, mostly abandoned back-boning a steep bluff that overlooks the casino. Blaze and Nomi dismount their bikes. She stares at a particularly ramshackle house. Wind whips. Dead leaves blow. A rusting swing-set twists and creaks. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd be back here. They pass cautiously through the front yard. Nomi's picku is parked nearby. The front door bangs back and forth. No pulls a revolver from her waist-band. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're gone. Off Nomi's look, Blaze points at tire tracks in the dirt. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dual tracks. Looks like your old man switched to a Hummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Window panes RATTLE. The lights don't work. Blaze and Nom pick their way through food containers and discarded detr BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess the boys camped out for a while.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dead leaves twirling. One whole side of the room is burne open, blackened and charred, the remaining timbers sealed with plastic sheeting. Nomi opens a drawer, rifles throug singed papers -- finds an old PHOTO of her and Carrigan. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, those things Vince said -- BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to explain yourself to me. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them are true. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't make you a bad person.
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomi nods, but she's clearly agitated. Blaze crouches, traces his fingers over a stain on the wall. He can FEEL something. He shuts his eyes, opens them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room, many years earlier. Carrigan backhands Nomi acr the face. The silent moment is caught in motion so slow i virtually a tableau.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to hit you. A statement, not a question. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomi is reluctant to enter. Blaze is inside, SEES her hesitation -- she's staring at the bed. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see the past? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just echoes, sometimes. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Starke. Nomi hesitates, not wanting to relive this. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dying. I'd shot myself full of Billy's best gear. Figured I'd teach him a lesson and go out in style. Blaze nods, but he doesn't see Nomi now. He SEES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nomi as she waS. An inch away from eternity. She is lying on the bed, staring upwards, shallow breaths- Above her, a MOTH flutters by a light, casting distorted shadow

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But it felt like a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: NOMI ON THE BED
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights begin to dim. We hear FOOTSTEPS approaching, muted and distorted, A SHADOW falls across Nomi -- STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands above her. There are OTHER SHADOWS drifting in beh him. Things better left half-glimpsed. Coyotes. Beasts.

dialogues.speaker: NOMI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He smiled and said -- As Starke starts to speak, we hear: BLAZE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You look like --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: Blaze finishing the phrase, knowing the punch-line too we BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you could use some help." Nomi nods, hugs herself. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I took it. What else was I going to do? I don't know what happened after that. I'm not sure I ever want to -- (beat, struggling) All I know is, nine months later, Rain was born. FLASHBACK IMAGES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent, disjointed. The moth. Nomi's face, terror-stricke Starke, eyes alight with malice and mischief.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: Nomi turns away, trying to banish the memory. NOMI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Ray hated her from the moment she was born. He knew she wasn't his, knew she was different -- (re: the charred timbers) If I didn't leave he would've killed us both. (CCNTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) FLASHBACK IMAGES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomi striking back at Billy-Ray with a broken bottle. Setting the house ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: Nomi pulls out a cigarette, nervously lights it. NOMI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been running ever since. In my heart, I guess I knew Starke would be coming for her one day. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why send Billy-Ray after you? NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick irony, I guess. Billy certainly knew all my haunts -- (shaking her head) This was a mistake, Blaze. We're not going to find anything here. Blaze glances down -- a HEAT HAZE has engulfed his hand. clenches his fist, looks up -- BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess again. -- as HEADLIGHTS shine through one of the windows. Somebody's driving up to the house.

dialogues.text: Talked-to Billy-Ray, chief. Don't know who you a r - e, but you picked the wrong -- Blaze struggles to contain the Ghost Rider, but his whole body is drenched in sweat now -- like he's going to spontaneously combust at any moment. BLAZE

dialogues.text: Please. Just tell us where they went and leave. There's no reason why you have to die. Rodenburg LAUGHS, looks at his friends in disbelief. RODENBURG

dialogues.text: I want out of here, I'm getting out! RODENBURG

dialogues.text: Keep your fucking voices down! WEINGROD

dialogues.text: RED-HOT CHAINS whip viciously around Weingrod's head and torso. Then he's wrenched backwards, hauled straight thro the plastic sheeting --

dialogues.text: bursts through the melting plastic, hauls his red-hot mon bike up on its back wheel -- Rodenburg and Pennebaker run for their lives, falling int the fire-lit passage. dialogues.text: Half man, half monster, his pitiless skull-face hazing an flickering between human and inhuman states. GHOST BLAZE

dialogues.text: A sub-par motel 6. Nomi's battered pickup is parked outsi We HEAR Blaze's tortured MOANS coming from within.

dialogues.text: Blaze sits in a chair, shirt off, Nomi at his side. She's trying to help him patch up his wounds, but the enormity the damage and the sheer amount of blood is daunting. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- I don't know what else to do for you -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'okay -- just need to rest now -- (GASPING)

dialogues.text: -- wounds'11 be healed by morning. Nomi stands, still shaken. She retrieves a cigarette from her purse, lights it. NOMI

dialogues.text: I thought you were dead. BLAZE

dialogues.text: (considering his wounds) I don't even know if it's that's an option anymore. Blaze sits forward, gritting his teeth against the pain. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, the Ghost Rider -- it's drawn to darkness like a bloodhound. If it thinks you've sinned, it'll find you. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you're innocent? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's innocent. (beat, staring at her) Think about it. Everyone's done somethincr. You. Me -- Blaze lifts up the coyote coin, flipping it over his fing BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Every night I spin this fucking coin -- and it always lands the same side up. I keep thinking -- ona time, one time I'm going to spin it and I'll see the other face. Sleep through the night without getting blood on my hands. But it never happens. (SHAKING)

dialogues.text: There's always some sad motherfucker out there that needs retribution, vengeance -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.text: Blaze flings the coin away in disgust. It spins, wobbles, lands coyote side up. He laughs tiredly, then looks away, lost, suddenly overcome with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: I'm just so fucking tired -- Nomi moves to his side, struggles to help him up. NOMI

dialogues.text: Here, why don't you lie down for a little while? Blaze nods, too tired to argue. Nomi half carries him to bed, lowers him down. Blaze settles back, exhausted. Nomi watches him, holding vigil. His eyes grow heavy. He shuts them a moment, opens them again -- THE PAST

dialogues.text: -- and it's Roxanne who is laying beside him now. She rol over to face him, smiles sleepily. Blaze reaches for her, touches her face -- and the moment shatters into violence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: ( 3)

dialogues.text: You must've loved her a lot. Blaze doesn't answer. Just takes the photos and wedding b from her, shoves them back in his pack. He pulls out one the postcards, scribbles an address on it. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little after three. BLAZE

dialogues.text: What time, exactly? NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3:27. Why? Blaze ignores her, jots down the time. Licks a stamp and puts it on the postcard. Leaves it on the dresser. NOMI (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: What is it with you and those postcards, anyway? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just a kind of record. (hauling up his pack) Let's go.

dialogues.text: Blaze and Nomi drive. Outside, the landscape passes, bugs twirling and spattering against the windshield like snowflakes. MEMORY FLASHES

dialogues.text: Roxanne in the hospital, serene and beautiful. Starke handing Blaze the coin. NOMI

dialogues.text: You made a deal. Blaze nods. NOMI (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: So what happened? Did she live? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne? Yeah, she's alive. She just doesn't know it. (off Nomi' s look) Coma. Probably never wake up. NOMI

dialogues.text: So he tricked you. BLAZE

dialogues.text: (a tired laugh) That's what he does, doesn't he? She nods. That's what he does. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost afraid to ask) What about the baby? Blaze just shakes his head. BLAZE

dialogues.text: It's funny. That kid was supposed to be my second chance. Rox and I used to talk about it -- how things'd be different after she was born. Nomi didn't expect his honest vulnerability. NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's why we have them BLAZE

dialogues.text: What, kids? NOMI (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can make amends for all the royal fuck-ups we've perpetrated on the world. God knows I've had my share. (beat, pained) I just don't want her to have to pay for the things I've done. You know? Blaze nods. He knows all too well. He and Nomi drive on i silence for a beat, their thoughts turning inwards. NOMI (CONT'D)

CONTINUED: (2) BLAZE

dialogues.text: I don't know. How do you beat the Devil? Walk up and bitch-slap him? Pretend you're Schwarzenegger and fire a bazooka up his hind ass? I'm basically making this up as I go along. Nomi smiles. NOMI

dialogues.text: I know. I'm on my own. (beat, more plaintive now) , Just bring her back to me. That's all I care about. BLAZE (NODDING)
