dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze waiting, internal. Carrigan manically cutting his d of cards. Over and over. Blaze suddenly CRIES OUT, throwing himself onto the floor He begins to writhe as the other prisoners jeer at him.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: was if you invited it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomi bolts into the room, frantic. She shakes Rain awake. The child looks up, SEES the terror in her mother's face. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom --?! NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweety, you have to get out of here now. FOLLOWING NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she drags Rain into the bathroom. She tears the shower curtain back. There's a window just above the shower stal barely big enough for someone like Rain to squeeze throug

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm not sure about that. At least not anymore. What I CQ know is this: (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear FOOTSTEPS in the walkway outside. SOMEONE is comi Nomi tugs open the window, lifts Rain towards it -- NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, go, GO! ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other prisoners are SHOUTING, fed up with Blaze's "antics". He-rolls about, clutching at sides. Fire stream from his mouth, his-eyes --

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are born alone and we die alone.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIGAN,
dialogues.text: terrified, backing into the far corner of his cell.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER PRISONERS
dialogues.text: pause, watching the beginning of Blaze's transformation, their CRIES taking on an entirely new kind of urgency.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's what happens in-between that matters.

dialogues.speaker: INT_ MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Rain squirms through the window, drops to the ground outs

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- the choices we make, the people whose paths we cross -- She stands, casts a fearful look to at Nomi, then runs of into the stormy night. ON NOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: backing out of the bathroom as the front door EXPLODES OP She turns around --

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- these are the things that determine our fate. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands in the doorway, coyotes slouching in around his he The beasts attack, growing and changing, their gnashing mouths of razored teeth opening wide to consume Nomi as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- FWOOOSHH!!! A mushrooming blast-wave of HELLFIRE erupt from Blaze's body, expanding beyond his cell and across t CORRIDOR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain runs for her life, weeping, distraught, stumbling do rain-slick hillside. She SEES -- THE TOWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spread out below, FIREBALLS engulfing a distant building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost Rider stands in the center of Blaze's cell, a cyclone of hellfire swirling around him -- for there is a direct, casual relationship between the amplitude of his and the number of transgressors in its vicinity. He moves forward, melting the cell bars, stepping into --

dialogues.speaker: THE CORRIDOR BEYOND
dialogues.text: The prisoners are frantic, leaping about like frightened animals. THOOM! THOOM! The Ghost Rider's heavy FOOTFALLS ring out it strides down the corridor, turning his awful gaze on t first cell. The Ghost Rider extends a hand, sending a STR OF HELLFIRE coursing over the prisoner within. The Ghost Rider moves on, to the second and third cells, swiveling his gaze back and forth, BURNING the occupants within. Like shooting fish in a barrel. THOOM! THOOM! The Ghost Rider continues its rampage. Murderers, rapists, malefactors. Some curse, others plead others simply drop to their knees and pray. For they know instinctively, that the universe is not an arbitrary plac that their Day of Judgement has come. The entire jail is ablaze now, a roiling extension of the Ghost Rider's fury, drowning out the VOICES OF THE DAMNED

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FINAL CELL
dialogues.text: where Carrigan cowers within. The deck of cards in his ha drops, scatters. Some of them catch fire, shrivel up -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost Rider waves his hand. The bars separating them melt, flowing to the floor like liquid. He stares down at Carrigan, his hollow eve sockets sparking to life.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE PENANCE STARE
dialogues.text: erupts from the Ghost Rider's eyes, Carrigan reaches for something beneath the bed -- cell wall. He holds it up. The effect is catastrophic, like the Medusa having her ow deadly gaze turned back upon her. The Ghost Rider stumble backwards, SHRIEKING, assaulted by an onslaught of subjec images. Visions horrifying enough to drive even a demon m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows of the jail pulse with HELLFIRE, panes of saf glass EXPLODING OUTWARDS as a blast-wave expands and expa making the world go white. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN from white. Another aftermath. A circus of PARAMEDICS, POLICE, FIREMEN and REPORTERS. Every corner i blackened, every bar twisted and melted. Charred CORPSES scattered like matchsticks. BOOTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are coming. We've seen them before. These boots belong to STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: navigating his way through the bedlam. He passes between rushing emergency personnel, steps over a writhing VICTIM -- but no one seems to notice his presence. And as he progresses to the far end of the cell block, the cacophon fades, leaving only his FOOTSTEPS as he turns into -- CARRIGAN'S CELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrigan is terribly burned, but still clinging to life. Frantic paramedics are running an IV, struggling to stabi him. His fear-filled eyes grow dim, then abruptly snap in focus as he SEES --

dialogues.speaker: STARKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You look like you could use some help. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Starke standing over him, his gaze stoic and pitiless.

dialogues.speaker: STARKE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: You lost her, Carrigan. What happened? CARRI GAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a choking sob) -- you didn't tell us -- what he was Carrigan starts to slip away. The SOUNDS of the outside world begin to intrude once more. Starke kneels, touching a hand to Carrigan's chest. The world ebbs away again. The paramedics continue their work oblivious. Carrigan MOANS. CARRIGAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- please, I don't want to die -- Starke's arctic eyes gleam bright with mischief. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could save you, would you be willing to make a deal? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze sits against an old grave marker, gun in hand. Thousand-yard stare in his eyes. He contemplates the gun SILENT MEMORIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: assault him -- good times with Roxanne, happy times, maki the onrush that much more unbearable. We INTERCUT --

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE,
dialogues.text: radiant at the beach. Flickering sunshine makes her squin

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BLAZE,
dialogues.text: here and now, cocking the gun, turning it back on himself ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: folding clothes, seen through a sunny doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BLAZE,
dialogues.text: fingering the trigger of the gun, edging closer to the unknown, the terrors that the afterlife holds for him. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her laughing face, loving Blaze from across a dinner tabl

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BLAZE
dialogues.text: suppressing a sob. The pain is too much. It's overwhelmin ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Blaze at the obstetrician's. On the sonogram monitor, SEE unborn child shifting positions within Roxanne's womb PUSH IN on the eerily beautiful image and --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BLAZE
dialogues.text: Fuck it. He presses the barrel against his forehead. Squeezes his eyes tightly shut, compresses the trigger -- -- but he can't do it. He lowers the gun, weeping with frustration and -- freezes, head cocked like he heard a voice. He scans the cemetery: graves, trees, nothing. The he spins around --- RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands behind him, waif-like. Big, melancholy eyes. They stare at each other for a long time, not knowing what to RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother is dead. The statement hangs. Another death. Another failure of Blaze's part. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How--? RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father found us, just like she knew he would. Rain looks down at Blaze's hand -- the gun resting there. Blaze meets her gaze and tucks the gun away, embarrassed. The wind picks up. Rain looks to the graves.

dialogues.speaker: RAIN, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: What do you think happens when you die? Do you think there's a heaven? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) RAIN (INSISTENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what do you think? Blaze studies Rain. This kid is hurting. What she needs now, is reassurance. And try as he might, Blaze just can' seem to harden his heart against her. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think there's something. Maybe not angels playing harps and stuff, but (SEARCHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- something. Rain wipes her nose with her sleeve, wanting to believe i RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll keep coming, you know. Unless you stop him. BLAZE (TIRED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that I can anymore. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'll try, right? Blaze regards her curiously. Even in grief, she's a consummate negotiator. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anything left to give, kid. Blaze stands, starts walking. Rain follows. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother said you were a good man. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said I could trust you. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. RAIN (PERSISTENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't you think there's a reason why all of this is happening? Like fate? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3) BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in fate. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it believes in you. Blaze stops. Cold. Deja-vu all over again. He looks back at Rain. Sighs. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered truck full of MIGRANT FARM-WORKERS grinds to a halt. Blaze and rain jump out in a cloud of dust. DRIVER (POINTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alla! Mision de Sante Lupia! High up the mountain: an old adobe building perched on stilts, precariously overhung. On top of its bell tower, crucifix stands clear and proud. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to a church? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a church. It's a mission. They take people in. Blaze pays the driver. The truck roars away. Rain looks back to the mission, doubtful. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to dump me there? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18th Century Spanish adobe. Chapel and dormitory, current under renovation. VARIOUS TOUGH-LOOKING MEN are at work. Picks and hoes clink in the dirt. Blaze and Rain make their way towards the main building. TOLBEIN (40s, hard, mistrustful) intercepts them. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our car broke down a few miles back and my daughter and I were wondering if we could crash here for the night. Tolbein sizes them up -- doesn't like what he sees. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think so. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a ride, then? Is there a town somewhere you could take us to? Other men have gathered behind Tolbein -- VISCOTT, WILSON One of them, NUNEZ, nods to the South. NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you head back to Dawson? They got motels there. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not really an option. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd say you're out of luck. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you must have a cot, something. The kid's hungry --

dialogues.speaker: RHYMER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can figure something out. JOE RHYMER, 50s, approaches, silences Tolbein with a look He's down to earth, capable, wearing a black shirt, cleri collar, oily jeans, and muddy work boots. RHYMER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering his hand) Joe Rhymer. I'm the Padre. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rain. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain? That's a pretty name. (TO RAIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry, Rain? Would you like something to eat? Rain nods. Rhymer ushers them inside. As he moves to follow, Tolbein stops him. (CONTINUED)     94 CONTINUED: (2) TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom line, Father. There's something wrong with those two. Especially the kid. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duly noted, Richard. (POINTEDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And overruled.

dialogues.speaker: A RAGGEDY FIGURE
dialogues.text: jutting into frame in the foreground. Blaze pauses at the threshold of the chapel, looks back, uneasy -- but it's j a SCARECROW being buffeted about by the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhymer leads Blaze down the central aisle. The chapel is dark, lit by candle-light, crowded with scaffolding and d sheets. As Blaze walks, the flames of the candles bend in his direction -- as if drawn by some unseen magnetic forc BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those men outside -- RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of them are on a work-release program. We're a halfway house for ex- offenders. We try to get people on their feet, reintegrate them into society. Blaze glances at Rain, apprehensive. RHYMER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misreading Blaze's look) Don't worry, you're perfectly safe here. But of course, that's not what Blaze is thinking. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain sits at the table, spooning her soup. Tolbein, Nunez and a few others watch them. Blaze watches them back, nonchalant in the face of their obvious hostility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUILDERS working. Men carrying provisions. There's a smal vegetable garden in the center of the courtyard. Rain hel the GARDENER pull carrots. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze watches from a distance, cleaned up, clothes launde Rhymer approaches, gestures to the garden. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's turned out beautiful, hasn't it? We try to be as self sufficient as we can, back to the earth and all that. He notices that Blaze is staring at the lowering sun. RHYMER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You any good with diesel engines? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my way around a flywheel housing. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I've got a generator out back that's been on life support the last few weeks. Mind helping me try to resuscitate it? Blaze looks at him curiously. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze and Rhymer work by flashlight, tinkering with the o generator. There are a number of vehicles stored around them, including a pair of dusty motorcycles. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long have you been running? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. You spend as much time around lost souls as I have, you learn how to read a man's face. (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hand me that crescent wrench? Blaze hands Rhymer the wrench, who then makes an adjustme RHYMER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the girl, for instance. She's not your daughter, is she? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened to her mother? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill her? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Rhymer studies Blaze, decides he believes him.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZE, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: (ELABORATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have anyone else. I'm just trying to protect her. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who's protecting you?

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER,
dialogues.text: Blaze and Rhymer are cleaning up. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I appreciate what you're trying to do, but I've never really been a come to Jesus kind of guy. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking about Jesus, I was talking about a little healthy introspection. Working here, staying in one place for a while, seeing what surfaces. I've found that people tend to arrive on our doorstep for a reason. Blaze considers this formidable man, a yearning moment then he shakes his head. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay. I'm sorry. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the girl, then? Whatever you're involved in, I can't imagine it's good for her well-being. (beat, gentle) We can find a home for her. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) BLAZE (UNSURE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to leave tonight -- Rhymer nods, understanding, he motions towards a beautifu motorcycle parked back in the shadows -- a `71 Norton Commando 850. Black, with gold pin-striping. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take the Norton. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any money. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So send us some when you do. Blaze is moved by this man's simple humanity -- but he's wrestling with the idea of abandoning Rain. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME-LAPSING SHADOWS cross the mission buildings and the surrounding wilderness landscape. The lonely scarecrow stares button-eyed and blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze gazes into a bathroom mirror. Been here so many tim before. SOUNDS intrude upon his solitude. He bows his head, studies the coin, turning it over in hi shaking fingers. The malicious coyote, the soaring eagle. Still the SOUNDS come, stronger, more insistent -- Cars CRASHING. Police SIRENS wailing. SCREAMS. GUNFIRE. FLAMES. Blaze looks up once more. His eyes are shadowed sockets. This is the real PENANCE STARE, and Blaze is feeling its awful, mournful ache. NOMI'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to know if you're a bad man. He wants to know -- if the Ghost Rider turned its penance stare on you, would you burn? Blaze clenches his fist around the coin, spins on his hee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze pauses in the doorway, looking in on Rain, who slee dead to the world. Blaze sets the coyote coin on the bed table next to her, turns and leaves. We HOLD ON Rain's sleeping face for a beat, then she stir opening her eyes. She SEES the coin nearby, sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Norton Commando ROARS into life, blasting webs from t exhaust. Blaze guides the bike up the coal ramp and out through the open cellar doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STORM FRONT is moving in, huge thunderheads gathering a roiling. Blaze pulls a dusty skid, pauses with the engine RUMBLING. Looks back forlornly at the mission. Then he wrings the throttle and hauls away into the night as we -

dialogues.speaker: A DORM ROOM WINDOW
dialogues.text: Rain stands at the glass, watching Blaze leave. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhymer and leads his wards in prayer. We can hear the WIN rising outside, gathering in strength. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH Rain down a moonlit corridor- She clutches th coyote coin like a talisman, then --- SEES SOMETHING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: through a window which startles her -- only to realize th it's just the scarecrow out in the field, flapping wildly (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "For the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and shew unto you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested unto us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RHYMER CONTINUES: RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ. And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full. This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light -- " CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze rides like the wind along a snaking road, away from storm clouds churning behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RHYMER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- and in him is no darkness at all."

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD,
dialogues.text: the land falls sharply away, spilling down into a wide expanse of moonlit ocean pregnant with the promise of release. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhymer and his men eat. Rain is there too. Nunez peers ou into the darkness. Wind and debris are scratching at the window panes. We hear THUNDER now, too. NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padre. You'd better take a look at this. Rhymer joins him. SEES what he SEES: COYOTES gathering. S or more. They creep malevolently towards the mission. NUNEZ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see anything like that before? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhymer shakes his head, looks to -- RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's acutely conscious of the men staring at her now, st clutching the coin like a rabbit's foot. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her -- she's the one doing this. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Richard. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Father, there's something wrong with -- CRASH! One of the windows SLAMS open, startling everyone. Rhymer moves to it, latches it shut again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING flashes. An eerie HOWLING arises. Tolbein and Nunez lead some men to the front door. Tolbein unbars the door, pulls it open, can't believe his eyes: THREE DOZEN HOWLING COYOTES, approaching the entrance. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?! SCARE! A snarling coyote comes out of left field, just misses his throat -- Tolbein leaps backward, SLAMS the door. The men start SHOUTING. Rain backs away. She knows what's happening. WHAM! An animal rams the door. Then another. And another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhymer breaks out a shotgun, shells, hears the men SHOUTI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhymer rushes in. The men are confused, afraid. WHAM! WHAM! GROWLING coyotes are hurling themselves repeatedly against the windows, cracking the panes. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from the windows! (TO WILSON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson, take Rain to the chapel. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson hesitates, eyeing Rain with distrust- WILSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't going nowhere with her. All the men are giving Rain a wide berth now. WHAM! Anoth snarling coyote hits the glass. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of you, please, just take the kid to the chapel. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, that's the last place she should be. CRUNCH! Something strikes the room a massive blow. Something MUCH BIGGER than a coyote. Viscott starts prayi NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, Viscott! THUMP! CRUMP! More heavy blows. Like the Fist of God. Making the floorboards beneath their feet vibrate. SOMETH shambles past the window. What in God's name was that? TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Rain, accusing) I knEw we should've sent them away! THOOM! Another impact. THOOM!THOOM! Plaster cracks. Dust falls. Viscott wails, praying even more stridently. Nunez is losing it_ NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: SHUT THE FUCK UP, MAN
dialogues.text: TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one they want, I'm telling you! -- and the lights abruptly go ou The storm bellows and blusters. The men huddle together, fear thick and sour.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Raainn -- Raaaaiinnn -- A gastly VOICE, monstrously corrupt, but still recognizab as Billy-Ray Carrigan.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: -- where are you, Rainnnnnnn? Rain shrinks away from the insidious mewling. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rhymer, hissing) I told you -- Even Rhymer is shaken now. He moves to investigate, press up against a cracked window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrigan stands outside, lurching between patterns of moonlight and shadow. But the movement is all wrong. And our momentary glimpses of him, we get the sense that he's been horribly changed -- as if his body had been torn apa then haphazardly reassembled into something else. CRUNCH! The wall fractures. Rhymer staggers back. WHUMP! CRUNCH! A row of impacts moves along the wall -- Tolbein and Nunez scramble to reach the dining room door. They close it, turning the locks. WHANG! Carrigan slams against the other side of the heavy steel door. WHANG!WHANG! Again and again and again. The men are terrified, SHOUTING at each other. The door is buckling inward, the hinges bending and GROANING -- Then the pummelling stops. Just the sound of BREATHING, halting and phlegmatic. No one moves, not a whisper. CORROSION starts to spread across the metal door. NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck --?! Rhymer edges close to the decaying door, peering through in the frame -- Carrigan peers back, moonlight illuminating his face. The are buttons where his eyes should 12P. He BELLOWS: CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: The POUNDING begins anew, harder now. The weakened door i surely about to give way. Rain is terrified. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what he says! Put her out! RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back with the others! (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3) TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't do what it says, that thing outside there's gonna kill us all. Rhymer steps in front of Rain, levels his shotgun at Tolbein's chest. RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God as my witness, Richard, lay a hand on that girl and I will pull this trigger. Tolbein hesitates -- then grabs at the shotgun. He twists from Rhymer's hands, SMASHES the butt across Rhymer's jaw Rhymer sinks to the floor. Tolbein grabs Rain, drags her SCREAMING to the door. He waves the shotgun at the others -- TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the fucking door! DO IT! Nunez fumbles with the lock. Rhymer recovers, throws hims at Nunez, tries stop him from opening it. The pounding ceases. All eyes sweep to the door -- TWO BUTTONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: roll through the gap between the bottom of the door and t floor, coming to rest at Rhymer's feet -- immediately oot the floorboards beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (a skin-crawling whisper) I can see you, Priest. I can see every last one of you.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR BURSTS OPEN,
dialogues.text: knocking Tolbein, Rain, Rhymer and Nunez on their asses. eyes bug as Carrigan shoulders his way inside. Only he's Carrigan anymore. Now he's -- THE SCARECROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A golem of dessicated flesh knitted together with straw a sodden burlap, pieces of insects, twine, and razor wire. Button-socket eyes. Jagged bone teeth. Beetle-black chiti for fingers and nails. His very existence is an affront to nature. Everything th Scarecrow touches instantly corrodes and decays. Floorboa rot, metal rusts. Every movement, every spastic shudder a twitch is a source of incalculable pain. (CONTINUED)     104 CONTINUED: (4)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scarecrow thrusts his hand out and a STORM OF DEMONIC CROWS explodes from his chest, whirling about like a cycl of knives. Now the coyotes enter too. Dozens of them, SNARLING, DIVI at the men, sinking their jaws into flesh. The men are trapped. Some try to flee. Others fight back, swinging chairs and planks -- THE SCARECROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stalks into their midst, snaring victims left and right, HURLING bodies or pulling them apart -- He snatches Viscott up by his throat. Bugs swarm over the SCREAMING parolee's face as it rots and decays. In second Viscott's entire body decomposes, putrefies, falls apart

dialogues.speaker: RHYMER AND RAIN
dialogues.text: back up towards the kitchen. SCREECH! A crow-thing comes flapping. Rhymer FIRES. The creature SHRIEKS and flops -- Nunez claws another from his face, SEES it's not a crow a all, but some kind of wriggling eyeless monstrosity with deformed razor beak, matted feathers, bony talons -- Wilson, trapped under a bench, BEATS desperately at a gnashing coyote. Lands a real blow. The beast falls back then stands up like a man? VARIOUS ANGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the OTHER COYOTES do likewise. The coyotes are changin shape, enlarging, canine skeletons CRACKING and re-arrang themselves into -- JAW-BEASTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same half-glimpsed horrors we glimpsed accompanying Starke. All muscle and gnashing fangs and bloody, ripping claws. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze rolls the Norton to a stop. Kills the engine. Sits back in the saddle and drinks in the night. The moonlit landscape is profoundly silent, the starry sk clear and awesome. Nothing stirs. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a cricket, not a lizard. Just the moonlit expanse of ocean below. Then we hear THUNDER, like distant artillery Blaze looks back over his shoulder -- BLAZE'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant thunderheads. LIGHTNING flickering. CLOSE ON Blaze, trying to drive Rain from his mind. We ca SEE on his face that it's a losing battle -- for poor, cu Johnny Blaze has finally understood his purpose on this e CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claws and jaws and razor-beaks tearing frenziedly through wood and plaster and lathe. Rhymer, Rain, Nunez and Tolbe struggle to repel the monsters, beating them back with whatever is at hand -- -- but the jaw-beasts and razor birds are winning, forcin their way into the kitchen -- Nunz is snagged. Slashing claws swarm all over him. The others try to pull him free -- Rhymer wastes two more precious SHOTS, but Nunez is lost. Dragged SCREAMING into the storm of mouths and claws. The survivors fall back as the door gives and -- THE SCARECROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pitches through the opening, lurching forward. Jaw-beasts fall in behind him. Razor birds whirl around his head. The survivors scramble for the far exit. Rain opens every gas burner on the grill as she passes by -- but the far e is locked. And Rhymer doesn't have the key! BOOM! Rhymer shotguns the lock! The lock fractures, but t exit still won't open. Tolbein starts kicking. Rhymer aim AGAIN -- RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tugging at Rhymer) Shoot the gas! RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: THE SCARECROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: advances. Bugs swarm from beneath his tattered feet. Ever metal implement and surface rusts as he passes. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the grills)

dialogues.speaker: SHOOT THE GAS
dialogues.text: Rhymer hears the ranges HISSING and FIRES. CHOOM! The gas fireballs, catches Scarecrow full-on sideways. He squeals reels. Burning jaw-beasts writhe and howl. Rain falls to the floor, dropping the coyote coin. It spi furiously as we -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze. Coming back. Ninety_ One hundred. Wind tears wildly at his hair, jacket. The bike shudders. The tachometer edges upwards -- One twenty. One twenty-five. Nitrous booster. The Norton SCREAMS. One thirty. One forty. One fifty -- HEAT streams off Blaze. FLAMES wisp from his nostrils. On sixty. One seventy. The tachometer SHATTERS. The engine smokes. The bike SHRIEKS, pushing the edge of mechanical reason. FLAMES explode from Blaze's mouth and eyes. His hands ignite. He CRIES OUT in agony. His body alters violently. His face warps. Bones crack and shift. Flesh shrinks and tightens as the skull-visage emerges. The bike changes too, red heat spreading throughout. Tortured metal SCREECHES. Straining machinery pops and bulges. Shafts lengthen into skeletal "bones". The saddle slouches. The tank distends -- WHOOMPF! The wheels ignite, then the whole bike. HELLFIRE streams, an extension of Blaze's rage. Blaze SCREAMS from the pit of his soul as the Ghost Rider claws itself into being, more manifest that ever before - And that's when the bike really accelerates - -- so fast that its air wake churns the dust on each side (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: so fast that molten asphalt spumes from behind like lava. -- so fast that the goddamn camera can barely catch it an B-BOOM!!! The hellcycle breaks MACH 1, SONIC BOOMS rockin the landscape as we -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Scarecrow, savagely burnt by the blast, but unstoppable. He rises, cocks his head, hears something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jaw-beasts_ The razor birds. All pause. All listen. They know something's coming. Something fast. Something b We hear it now too -- the WHINE of an APPROACHING ENGINE.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COYOTE COIN
dialogues.text: wobbling to a stop, coyote side up. Realizing what's about to happen, the Scarecrow lets loos GHASTLY WAIL and --

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOST RIDER
dialogues.text: erupts through the wall in DEEP SLOW MOTION, sending fort majestic tsunami of fire and debris. The monster bike ski carves floorboards like matchwood --

dialogues.speaker: JAW-BEASTS AND RAZOR BIRDS
dialogues.text: hurl themselves out of its scorching path -- The Ghost Rider vaults from the saddle, sends the bike spinning at the scurrying monsters. It ninepins a few, ta out the rest as it impacts the wall like a nuke -- THE CROW-THINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are vanquished, squealing and flopping like living cinder

dialogues.speaker: BUT THE JAW-BEASTS RECOVER,
dialogues.text: still aflame but very much alive. If anything, they seem emboldened by the fire. They circle the Ghost Rider, more and more of them joining the pack. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOST RIDER
dialogues.text: readies his chains. The jaw-beasts attack. Three dozen horrors pouncing and GNASHING. The Ghost Rider takes them Chains, flames, sheer power and force -- Spines snap. Lupine skulls burn. The Ghost Rider tears th monsters limb from limb. The room becomes the Seventh Cir of Hell, and at the heart of the Inferno, the Ghost Rider exults in the slaughter -- The whole mission is ablaze now, fire and churning smoke consuming everything in its path. Rhymer, Rain, and Tolbe run for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain, Rhymer and Tolbein are trapped. Fire has cut them o They back their way towards the rear of the building, pee out the windows -- THEIR POV:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a hundred foot drop straight down to the highway. TOLBEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way down from here! CRACK! The door behind them splinters. The Scarecrow's found them once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost Rider is having difficulty with the jaw-beasts. His fire burns them but they just keep coming -- blackene skeletal demons, possessed of an unstoppable ferocity -- For every one he throws aside, two more seem to take its place. He can wound them, sear the flesh from their bones but still they pile on, sinking their teeth into his skel flesh, CRUNCHING through his hollow rib-cage -- The Ghost Rider SHRIEKS in pain, TEARS one from his back, SNAPS another's spine, PUNCHES a fist through a third's gnashing muzzle. He falls back through a doorway, onto -- A STAIRCASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And still, they attack. And now the Ghost Rider is weakening. He stumbles on the steps, falls to his knees. The fiends pile atop his back -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summoning all his power, the Ghost Rider emits a SHOCKWAV FLAME, a HEAT-BOMB that blasts the creatures clean off hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOCKWAVE shakes the room. FIRE belches through the splintered doorway -- -- but the Scarecrow scarcely notices. He's flinging dorm beds left and right, HOWLING and GROANING as he hunts for RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: huddled beneath a flimsy bed-frame. SCARECROW

dialogues.speaker: RAAAAINNN
dialogues.text: The Scarecrow hurls aside a bed and finds Tolbein. He reaches for the man, sinking his spindly finger's into Tolbein's chest. Tolbein SCREAMS, instantly shrivelling, corroding into dust -- The Scarecrow hurls aside yet another bed and finds -- RHYMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aiming his shotgun, point-blank range! BLAM! The BLAST Takes a chunk out of the Scarecrow's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Hell breaks loose. The Ghost Rider unleashes wave aft wave of HELLFIRE, incinerating the hounds as they leap towards him, fighting his way up and up the steps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Another BLAST chews apart the Scarecrow's neck. The monstrosity staggers, then lurches forward, grabbing the barrel of the shotgun, instantly corroding it -- The wave of corrosion swarms up the stock while towards Rhymer's hands and he drops the gun, rolling away, scoopi up Rain as he runs towards the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE SCARECROW,
dialogues.text: recovering, his makeshift flesh knitting itself back toge Flames kiss his body, causing sodden particles on his fra SIZZLE and POP -- but because his decayed flesh is so wet never ignites. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enkindled BUZZING bug-ember things swirl around the Scarecrow's head in a halo, impossibly alive- He stumbles after Rhymer and Rain into THE BATHROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A claustrophobic box of stalls and urinals. Rhymer and Ra are nowhere to be seen. Enraged, the Scarecrow tears into the stalls, ripping them aside one by one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost Rider advances, hurling jaw-beasts left and rig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scarecrow rends the last stall asunder, finds Rain an Rhymer cowering like bugs. He looms above Rain, beetle- fingers clutching, flashing a rotted rictus-grin -- SCARECROW

dialogues.speaker: -- GOT YOU'.
dialogues.text: RED-HOT CHAINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whip viciously around the Scarecrow's sodden head and tor He's wrenched backwards, hauled out of the bathroom and SLAMMED across the dormitory into the opposite wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall fractures. Debris falls, tumbling hundreds of fe down to the highway below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scarecrow recovers, SEES the room ablaze. SEES a swat of blackened, twitching jaw-beast skeletons leading from doorway to --

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOST RIDER
dialogues.text: At the other end of the chains. More accurately,

dialogues.speaker: GHOST BLAZE,
dialogues.text: battered and weakened, staggering. His flames are barely flickering, his bony flesh has become chalky and brittle. He's holding a jaw-beast skeleton, drops it to the floor The Scarecrow attacks. Hand-to-hand combat. Massive blows and blocks. The burning room SHUDDERS with each impact -- (CONTINUED)     CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghost Blaze uses his chains, but he's weak, and Scarecrow turns them back on him, SMASHES him against the walls. Mo structural fractures, more dust --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole mission quakes. A huge hole in the wall falls open, the Scarecrow barely manages to stop himself fallin The stilt-like support columns bearing the weight of the overhanging mission begin to CREAK and bend. Some snap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dormitory drops alarmingly, ten feet or more, the flooring canting precariously. Ghost Blaze stumbles, fall WHAM! Scarecrow grabs Ghost Blaze's neck. Squeezes tight. A WAVE OF DECAY AND CORROSION spreads over Ghost Blaze. H SCREAMS, his flesh putrefying, but Scarecrow will not let

dialogues.speaker: ON RAIN AND RHYMER
dialogues.text: Desperate for escape, the flames closing in on them. Ther nowhere to go. Except a small HATCH, high up in the ceili

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Ghost Blaze HOWLS, in agony as the Scarecrow's superior e dominates. He feebly extends a hand towards the flames nearby, trying to compel the fire to him. The flames twis briefly bend in his direction. The Ghost Rider HOWLS with frustration. He needs the flames. He will die without the He tries again, reaching, reaching -- THE FLAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: surrounding the two foes are starting to bend in earnest streaming towards Ghost Blaze's bony, begging fingertips The Scarecrow is oblivious. Just keeps pouring more miser into Ghost Blaze's body as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the entire mission, which was only moments ago complet aflame, is now extinguishing itself. An inferno in retrograde, roiling inward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- raging flames bend and draw long -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- clouds of embers are pulled into coursing streams-.-- -- roiling fireballs are dragged wildly from walls, floor and ceilings -- -- flame and fury funneling thunderously into SCORCHING F SPOUTS that cyclone up and up and up into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ghost Blaze from every direction. Suddenly Scarecrow finds himself at the heart of a back- drafting firestorm, a sustained implosion feeding straigh into Ghost Blaze. Then -- Nuclear silence. An instant in which Rhymer shoves Rain through the hatch An instant in which Scarecrow senses his own doom -- Because the Ghost Rider is back- But now he's more than t Ghost Rider. He's a white-hot nuclear bomb fairly vibrati with volcanic heat. And he DETONATES. An apocalyptic release that -- obliterates Scarecrow -- sends Rhymer ducking for cover -- bulges the dormitory's fractured walls and ceiling, lifting the ATTIC FLOOR mightily. HURLING Rain into the a

dialogues.speaker: A FLAME TSUNAMI
dialogues.text: steamrollers through every room and passage, destroying everything in its path, consuming itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghost Blaze lies GROANING at blackened ground zero. He's almost human now, spent. Charred timbers CREAK and GROAN around him. The entire structure is on the verge of collapse. ON RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emerging from the smouldering bathroom, ghostly white. Sh picks her way cautiously across the teetering floor. Knee alongside Ghost Blaze -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze's eyes are black pits, gaunt and skullish_ Rain cas about, finds a BURNING EMBER, cups it in her hands, holds flame close to his mouth -- Ghost Blaze senses the fire, breathes it in like a drowni man. Draws the flame deep into his lungs, keeps drawing until the ember is gone, internalized. Their eyes meet. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to die? GHOST BLAZE (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. He pushes up on his elbows, tiredly rises to his feet and THE MISSION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topples. Ghost Blaze and Rain run -- but they're not goin to make it. The whole room is dropging away at their heel Ghost Blaze snatches up Rain, DIVES through a widening sp in the wall even as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the dormitory folds up and slides away from them, pitc over the hillside. Breaking into TONS OF PLUNGING DEBRIS that CRASH SPECTACULARLY onto the highway far below.

dialogues.speaker: ON GHOST BLAZE AND RAIN,
dialogues.text: clutching precariously to a muddy hillside. Ghost Blaze looks up, SEES --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN APPROACHING,
dialogues.text: first light bleeding in over the distant mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghost Blaze strides over the smoking ruins. Finds what he was looking for --

dialogues.speaker: CARRIGAN,
dialogues.text: back to human, hopelessly trapped deep in the wreckage. H barely alive, just a face in the rubble. Carrigan blinks. CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a ragged whisper) who -- the fuck -- are you, anyway? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: GHOST BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vengeance. And Ghost Blaze raises his hand, HELLFIRE trickling down length of his arm, swirling around his hand like a buildi static charge even as -- CARRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified, yet defiant) Do it, fucker -- dQ it. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: appears on a ridge just before them, eyes locking onto hi It's now or never. Ghost Blaze hesitates, hesitates -- then abruptly reins t flame back in. Metabolizes the fury. Pushes it down deep through sheer, agony-inducing willpower. Ghost Blaze SCREAMS, struggles -- -- and forces the Demon away, Now he's just Blaze, weak with exertion, but triumphant f the first time in years. He turns away and we -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT_ MISSION GROUNDS
dialogues.text: -- Blaze and Rain walking, working their way across the scorched grounds. Rain kicks at a carbonized jaw-beast skull. It rolls, SMASHES against a tree, crumbles to dust Blaze looks up just then, HEARS the sound of --- STARKE'S CADILLAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slows to a stop at the end of the drive, ENGINE RUMBLI Dusty and bug-begrimed from its cross-country journey. Blaze braces himself. A silent inhalation of breath. Rain stares, paralyzed by fear -- The driver's door opens. A hulking silhouette steps out. The Beast, backlit by the fiery dawn which is just breaki over the horizon. Sunlight FLARES outward, briefly blindi us. And when it subsides -- STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is standing there. Human. Windblown. He raises a hand, shielding his gaze from the light. Steps cowards them -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze moves in front of Rain, blocking Starke's path. They stand there in silence. And Starke smiles, eyes alig with mischief. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we've come to the end of the road, haven't we? BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so. After a long beat: STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the girl and I'll lift the curse. Blaze looks down at Rain. This was all he ever wanted. Th only thing that has kept him going all these years. He reaches into his jacket, retrieving a crumpled pack of cigarettes. Plucks one out -- BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all yours, Starke -- -- and lights it without a match, somehow conjuring the f from within himself. He takes a long drag. In the pits of his eyes, something glows there -- a kind of lambent darkness. BLAZE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but you'll have to go through me if you want her. Starke stares into Blaze's eyes. Doesn't like what he SEE STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool, Blaze. I'm offering you your life back. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a life. And least now one I'm interested in living. STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can control it. You can't. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'm willing to take my chances. Starke nods, accepting defeat. For now. He looks down at Rain, a bitter smile creeping across his face -- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) STARKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your mother's eyes. -- and walks away. Blaze and Rain watch him retreat. Presently, a coyote sli from shadows, joining him on the road. It--lopes along be him. We watch them disappear over a rise. Then they're gone. Beat. Rain studies Blaze, reaches for his hand. RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be back. BLAZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AMONGST THE SMOKING RUINS
dialogues.text: We pass broken concrete, smouldering timber, a rock snake constricting a mouse, an industry of beetles dissecting a bird's carcass. Finally, we come to a small, deep cavity and there, tucked away in the darkness, we find --

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And that's how it ended. With another beginning. A kind of balance struck between the flame and the fury. BLAZE'S COIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: balanced perfectly on it's edge. How it fell like that, a the heart of the wreckage, is a mystery that will probabl never be solved. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE brings a postcard to a sleeping patient's bedside The patient is ROXANNE, sleeping peacefully, bathed in sunlight. The nurse tacks the card to a wall filled with many -- dozens and dozens of postcards charting Blaze's journey back and forth across the country. And we realize now, that Roxanne is the woman who has bee narrating our tale. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And me? I still sleep. Wandering. Waiting. Listening to the whispers of the dead. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Blaze, riding hard, as a scorching desert noon TIME-LA into night.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The world turns around without me. There are sharks. And there are doves. And nighttime holds far darker terrors than death. But I am never afraid because I know that he is out there, somewhere. And that someday, somehow -- Blaze ignites, SCREAMS, hurls back his head --

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- he will return to me. -- and the Ghost Rider rockets headlong into black. THE END
